  • I thought there was some other stuff written on housing and land ownership previously. Regardless, I've gone over that now. Darker Dreams 11:24, 29 March 2008 (CET)

lockpick mechanics notes

thinking; make lockpicking a minigame? A puzzle where the (difficulty of lock) minus (the skill of the character) plus (a random roll) determines the parameters/difficulty of the puzzle. Have puzzles randomly created using that difficulty to determine the parameters, and the time to pick the lock is determined by the time it takes the player to solve the puzzle... Darker Dreams 11:24, 29 March 2008 (CET)

I like the idea, TES: Oblivion uses the same system, it would make the security skill the player has less important though. Maybe we can make the process involve the amount of skill in luck the player has. Jekkar 12:05, 29 March 2008 (CET)

I like the idea too- but I think disparity in player skills/intellect will create to large gap in ability between characters with the same skill level... I especially worry about the genius who never feels the need to improve his lockpick skill because he can play that game so well, and thus picks locks better than a player who has emphasized improving that skill. Which is bad. Darker Dreams 18:39, 29 March 2008 (CET)

  • We could set a max time and allow the game to simply be a "faster" option, which brings up those who fall below the curve. To restrain (and challenge) those who consistantly beat the clock have the problems become more difficult relative to their skill level. Darker Dreams 19:14, 29 March 2008 (CET)
